replies.body: Ekko, is one of the safest assassins there is in the game. That's the reason he isn't as bursty as Zed, Talon, Leblanc and other assassins. He excels at clean up duty and has a shittone of outplay potential engraved in his kit. Sure, he has lots of counterplay, but for the amount of CC, safety, AOE and other utility he has, that's fine.

Safer than Zed or LB?

Both that don't have mana costs on their returns?

agreed. luckily, riot is slightly buffing the stats they gave him in the 5.14 patch, so his mana consumption will be slightly less(unless they decide to reverse that), his q will do slightly more. >.> they still ruined his r tho

adding mana and lowering its range :C, range I get, but now he has no free escape like some other assassins, if he has less than 100 mana he is pretty much screwed.

The added mana cost on the r wasn't the best change they could have made in my opinion, I get there was a post about it and they happened to agree but without the reset ekko is now a solid sideliner pick without the safety buffer.

Zed and leblanc both have free resets like any good assassin, meaning they can get in and out. Ekko had it too but now he is super limited and people are buying mana regen to stay in a teamfight scenario... the changes they needed to make was buff his movement speed, nerf the slow on q to make it a stacking slow for both directions that amounts to less then it was (putting pressure on the two hit combo) and give him a shield when he gets 3 stacks of his passive yet remove the shield from his e and nerf the stun (and make it add a stack of his passive).

With these changes ekko should also appear on the other side of his target with his e and like gnar be able to miss catching his q but have the return range limited so he can't snipe with it. Food for thought
